intro: Oenothera gauroides, commonly known as the prairie evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom at night. The plant has hairy, glandular leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Oenothera gauroides is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
